data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is likely complete. Most of the songs were confirmed by the attached review and the rest were confirmed by attendees. If anyone has any information on what else was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Am I In Heaven? and I Wanna Be Your Dog were confirmed by audio/video and the remaining songs were confirmed by the attached reviews and the band's Facebook comments, however, any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show was an acoustic performance by Stu and Joey on Triple R. KGLW.net Staff Notes: This performance is believed to be complete. A recording exists of the Her and I (Slow Jam 2) / Slow Jam 1 performance as well as an interview, but no setlist exists to confirm if more was played. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Hot Water possibly was played by request, as a fan calls out "Hot Water" before it is played, but the same fan's request for Footy Footy is not granted. Between Slow Jam 1 and Am I in Heaven? Amby says, "That was our slow song. This is our fast song". Am I In Heaven? contained a Head On/Pill tease. Head On/Pill featured a brief semi-drum solo and Stu on flute. Joey ended the show with a shoutout to the headliner, White Fence.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - North America

data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is likely incomplete. Hot Wax was confirmed by an Instagram post. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.shownotes: KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is likely incomplete. Slow Jam 1 was confirmed by an Instagram post and Am I In Heaven? was confirmed by the attached video. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - North America

data.showtitle: Panache CMJ Day Party & Hangover Brunch
data.shownotes: Stripped down set played by Stu, Joey, and Cavs. This show featured the debut of Stressin'. Following Her and I (Slow Jam 2), Joey mentioned that it was "too early for jazz", to which Cavs briefly teased The River. During It's Got Old, Ambrose played harmonica from the audience. Vegemite was announced as a song about Australia's national dish. During God is Calling Me Back Home, which was played for the first time known since 2013-12-31 (73 show gap), Stu was brought a piece of cake by Tim Presley from White Fence and Cate Le Bond, which Eric and the band's manager Michelle Cable then fed to Stu. “Happy Birthday to You” was sung to Stu at the end of the set.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - North America

data.shownotes: Am I In Heaven? contained Cellophane and Head On/Pill teases KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. All songs were confirmed by photo/video. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.shownotes: Due to lack of space, Cavs and Eric played in front of the stage and Lucas played off to the viewers right. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is incomplete. Slow Jam 1 and Hot Wax were confirmed by audio/video and Her and I was confirmed by an audience report. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.shownotes: Am I In Heaven? contained a Head On/Pill tease. Head On/Pill contained Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. All the songs listed were reported by attendees. The Mind Fuzz suite, Empty, Slow Jam 1, Am I In Heaven?, and Sleepwalker were confirmed by audio/video. If anyone has any additional information about this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
data.tourname: 2014 I'm In Your Mind Fuzz - Australia

data.shownotes: This show took place as part of the Splendour XR “Festival”, a virtual event meant to replace the yearly Splendour in the Grass Festival. Slow Jam 1 was played for the first time since 2014-12-19. (411 show gap)

data.jamchart_notes: After starting off in a typically strong manner, the band briefly moves through a rather unique major key jam before returning to the normal mood of the jam. Much like the rest of the show, everyone is listening to each other with intent and improvising with precision to great result.
data.shownotes: This show was a fully acoustic warmup gig for acoustic night of the Princess Theatre residency and featured the debut of Most of What I Like. It's Got Old was played for the first time since 2015-09-13. (354 show gap) Sleepwalker was played for the first time since 2016-02-28. (325 show gap) Most Of What I Like contained “Praise You” (Fatboy Slim) teases. The intro to Sense contained “Come On” (The Notorious B.I.G.) quotes. Prior to Slow Jam 1 opening band The Bush was shouted out and mention was made that Ambrose's sister Edith is in the band. The song itself contained a Her and I (Slow Jam 2) tease.

This was the Acoustic Night show of the Princess Theatre residency, the first of five planned shows, each featuring a different specific genre and preannounced songs. The Bitter Boogie was dedicated to “the last two years.” Most Of What I Like contained Praise You (Fatboy Slim) teases. Her and I contained Slow Jam 1 quotes. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Brisbane '21. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

The show began with a chant of “fuck shit up” by the crowd, which was repeated several times throughout the show. Self-Immolate was introduced as a song about setting yourself on fire. Before starting Magenta Mountain the crowd’s chant was changed to “ma-gen-ta.” Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes. Supreme Ascendancy was introduced as a song about “how much Amby loves our lord and savior…Satan!” SPELLLING and The Chats were shouted out after Oddlife. Following Ontology Stu and the audience had a discussion of the apple that Stu was eating during the show. The Lord of Lightning contained a Cellophane tease. Before Dead-Beat, Stu announced that they would be playing an older song. This announcement prompted several requests from the audience, including God is in the Rhythm, “Taste of an Orange” (Almacknjack) and “Stairway to Heaven” (Led Zeppelin) which was then teased by Joey, who then claimed that he had no idea how to play that song and referred to it as Stairway to Kevin. Am I in Heaven? contained Her and I (Slow Jam 2) teases, God Is Calling Me Back Home teases, The Dripping Tap teases/quotes, Boogieman Sam teases/quotes, Rattlesnake teases, Hot Wax quotes and Head On/Pill teases/quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Special shout out to our very own @spidzzle for the recording located on Archive.org!
data.venuename: Event Lawn at Virgin Hotels Las Vegas

data.shownotes: Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases. Following Sea of Trees an audience member gave Stu a slap bracelet which he put on and then returned. Slow Jam 1 contained an Iron Lung jam with lyrics. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

2nd show with Cavs unable to play due to getting COVID. The band played with a drum machine, this time with no CAVS shirt. Magenta Mountain opened with a drum machine jam by Stu. Sadie Sorceress contained a lengthened intro where the band and crowd shouted Cavs. After Most Of What I Like, the band joked they would play Organ Farmer and Gaia with the drum machine next. Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. O.N.E. contained a Honey tease. Muddy Water and Float Along Fill Your Lungs were on the printed setlist at the end, but were cut.

Raining Blood (Slayer) played before and as the band came on stage. The River [1] contained Wah Wah teases and parts I, II, & III were played before transitioning to Wah Wah, which contained The River teases and quotes. Part IV of the The River was played after Road Train. Ambergris was introduced as having slap bass. After Ambergris, Joey shouts out opener Grace Cummings. Slow Jam 1 contained an Iron Lung vocal jam and Witchcraft teases. Ataraxia was introduced as "Tanaraxia", which was explained to be a song about Joey wanting to be tan. Sleep Drifter contained a Doom City and Billabong Valley tease. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster by Bjenny Montero Edition of 100

data.jamchart_notes: Highly improvisational and groovy, the jam starts out with percussive guitar work which morphs into some Ice V teasing and Iron Lung quotes. The jam moves into a psychedelic fury which quickly chills out and gets real spacey as Stu picks up the flute. Building up from a guitar, drums and flute trio, a heavy rocking and fast paced jam emerges, which simply rages. After a few minutes, Cavs shifts to a half time beat which transitions smoothly back into the song. “Well that took an unexpected turn” says Joey.
data.shownotes:
This show featured the live debut of A New World. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Flamethrower teases, as well as Iron Lung quotes. The Grim Reaper featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress played over the music to The Grim Reaper followed by Sadie Sorceress quotes and teases. Ice V contained Slow Jam 1 quotes. A New World through Altered Beast II featured narration by Leah Senior. Altered Beast I was played for the first time since 2022-10-05 (90 show gap). Alter Me I and Altered Beast II were played for the first time since 2019-10-06 (87 show gap). Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Leah Senior was shouted out after Magma. The Dripping Tap contained Hypertension quotes and Hell’s Itch and Head On/Pill teases.

Poster by Jason Galea
320 Standard / 40 Foil Print

This show featured the debut of Lava. Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes. The Book was introduced as a song by Jimi Hendrix and featured a Cavs drum solo. The Reticent Raconteur through The Balrog featured narration by Leah Senior. The Lord of Lightning contained a Cellophane tease. The Balrog contained a Trapdoor tease. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam.

Poster By Jason Galea
320 Standard / 40 Foil Print

data.jamchart_notes: The third of three monstrous October renditions sees the band grooving through Ice V teasing, before moving onto mystical and atmospheric passages, including a great breakdown jam at the 10 minute mark. The keys shine particularly bright in the back half of the jam. The band builds the energy back up to briefly return for a final refrain, before floating back to outer space for a little Magenta Mountain jam to close out.
data.shownotes:
The show began with a drum solo leading into Venusian 2. Before Predator X, an “Asheville Gatherum” shirt was thrown on stage, and Stu changed into it. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Magenta Mountain teases. Magenta Mountain was dedicated to Robert “Bob” Moog, inventor of the Moog synthesizer. Nuclear Fusion featured Lucas on the intro vocal. Another t-shirt was thrown up on stage after Iron Lung; Stu thanked everyone for the t-shirts noting that “I fucking stink like shit so it’s perfect.” After Stu declared that “showers are for squares,” Ambrose then suggested that Stu had never had a shower in his life, “only golden ones.” Wah Wah contained a The River intro, as well as teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap contained The Land Before Timeland teases.

Poster By Lewy Jones

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases. Slow Jam I contained Iron Lung teases. Opening acts The Prize and CLAMM were shouted out after Sense. Shanghai was introduced as being about a fight the band got into in Shanghai. Lava, Gamma Knife and People-Vultures were on the written setlist as the final three songs but were not played. Poster by Troppo Print Studio 200 Standard / 20 Foil Print

data.jamchart_notes: Big jam that turns Evil and segues into Self-Immolate
data.shownotes:
Sleep Drifter contained Rattlesnake and O.N.E. teases. The Book was introduced as a song about Satan and featured a Cavs drum solo. Evil Death Roll contained a Robot Stop tease. Lava contained Hypertension and Superposition teases. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V teases, Iron Lung quotes and Witchcraft teases. Self-Immolate featured another Cavs drum solo. Gila Monster was introduced as “a song about dragons and witches and shit”.

Poster By Carlo Vivary

Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Sense was teased immediately before and during Ice V, which contained a Hypertension tease. Ambergris was introduced as “Joey’s porno song”. The Dripping Tap contained Hot Water teases and quotes with the lyrics changed to “time to party” and “everybody wants to party”, and Cellophane teases. Boogieman Sam contained “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), “My Babe” (Little Walter) and “It's a Long Way to the Top (If You Wanna Rock 'N' Roll)” (AC/DC) quotes and Am I In Heaven? teases. Float Along – Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Poster By Lewy Jones

This show featured Stu singing lines of "Hey man" and lines about different "animals in Australia" throughout. Sea of Trees contained Shanghai quotes, as well as the "Let’s get real high and eat apple pie” quotes that would become Grow Wings and Fly. The return to Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap teases. The return to Sea of Trees featured Ambrose on sax. Iron Lung contained an intro jam similar to that of Lava. Sleep Drifter contained Doom City, Honey and Automation teases. Lucas did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and Hot Water teases. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Head On/Pill teases, a Hypertension jam, as well as "sexy alien" lyrics with an “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quote and E.T. references. Gaia was introduced as being called "Hey Man" and contained a Magma tease as well as a Motor Spirit jam and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Poster By Drew Millward

Scheduled opening band Kamikaze Palm Tree’s set was cancelled due to an inclement weather warning. Rattlesnake contained Sleep Drifter teases/quotes, Honey teases and Boogieman Sam quotes, and had some of the “rattle, rattle, rattle” refrains changed to “boogie, boogie, boogie.”  Slow Jam 1 was introduced as "probably [Ambrose's] favorite song of ours" and contained Iron Lung and Her and I (Slow Jam 2) quotes.  Hell contained a Superbug outro.  Ambergris and The Great Chain of Being were on the printed setlist but were not played.

Poster By Jason Galea
2000 Standard / 500 Foil

Robot Stop contained a Hot Water jam with lyrics and Evil Death Roll teases. Hypertension contained Hot Water teases. This Thing contained a quote of “Walkin’ on the Sun” (Smash Mouth). Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes. Poster by Michael Hacker

This show featured the debut of Le Risque, which featured vocals from Cavs, making it his vocal debut. Grace Cummings unfortunately had to cancel at short notice, and was replaced with local Austrian band, Hypnotic Floor. Venusian 2 was introduced as a song about Venus. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V, Sad Pilot, and Loyalty teases and a Chang'e (Extended) jam with lyrics. O.N.E. contained a Straws In The Wind intro. Billabong Valley was performed without Ambrose on guitar, but Stu on guitar for the second half and contained a Minimum Brain Size and Doom City tease. The banter between Billabong Valley and Le Risqué contained quotes and teases of My Generation by Limp Bizkit. Garden Goblin was introduced as being called Borat after Cookie’s vocals on the song. Iron Lung was dedicated to John Frusciante and contained Murder of The Universe, Witchcraft, and Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained a Robot Stop intro and teases of the new song and Evil Death Roll. Evil Death Roll did not contain the Invisible face segment and had Witchcraft, Converge, and Crumbling Castle teases. After the show, Ambrose sang “so long, farewell” from The sound of Music Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

This show featured the (incomplete) debut of Mirage City, and the debuts of Time = $$$ and You Can Be Your Silhouette. Iron Lung contained Witchcraft teases. Most Of What I Like contained Praise You (Fatboy Slim) teases. Time = $$$ was introduced as “Stairway to Heaven” (Led Zeppelin), which was then teased. You Can Be Your Silhouette contained an Iron Lung tease. The Bitter Boogie contained the drum pattern from Muddy Water and a lyric change to "shits his pants". Hot Water contained a Cellophane tease. Following Hot Water, Joey noted that the band has a microtonal acoustic guitar, but only one, and jokingly suggested that Stu should play Rattlesnake solo, who then sang it along with teases of it from Joey and Ambrose. Soon after, Stu teased “Hey Joe” (Jimi Hendrix) which led to Joey remarking he used to get made fun of for playing it in school. Following Trapdoor, Joey called Cavs down to ask him when he played drums, to which he replied around 16. Ambrose then quoted Pleura. Sad Pilot was introduced as a song about being sad. Following Sad Pilot, Stu quoted Rattlesnake again. Sense contained You Can Be Your Sillouhette teases and a Witchcraft tease. This Thing contained an "Incredible" (M Beat) quote. The intro to Slow Jam 1 contained a The River tease and the song itself contained Ice V teases. Before Witchcraft, Stu told a story about a fan giving him a CD of acoustic songs from PetroDragonic Apocalypse and that inspired the band to play Witchcraft acoustic. Poster by Amy Jean; Edition of 100

Hot Water contained Robot Stop, Am I In Heaven?, and The Dripping Tap teases. Robot Stop, which was incomplete, contained Ice V, Daily Blues, and Am I In Heaven? teases and Field of Vision quotes. The second Hot Water contained a chant of "New York City". Ice V contained a "Blindness" (The Fall) jam and improvised lyrics. The Bitter Boogie contained the drums from Muddy Water and Ice V teases. You Can Be Your Silhouette was introduced as a song about being who you want to be. Hot Wax contained You Can Be Your Silhouette teases. Converge was introduced as a song about storms before Planet B, as Stu confused them on the setlist. The Great Chain of Being contained an "On The Road Again" (Canned Heat) tease. Motor Spirit was dedicated to Cavs "because it's about cars" and contained a You Can Be Your Silhouette and Robot Stop tease. Slow Jam 1 contained Crumbling Castle, Sad Pilot and Ice V teases. Billabong Valley was preceded by a "Microtonal Jazz Jam" with Stu referencing Sexy Alien and Joey singing The Star Spangled Banner. In the song itself, Ambrose crowdsurfed on an inflatable gator and quoted Should I Stay Or Should I Go (The Clash). Following Automation, Joey shouted out opener Geese. A crowd member then told the band to play Fishing For Fishies and the full band (besides Cavs) teased it. The band then started to name classic rock songs and teased Stairway To Heaven and Moby Dick (both Led Zeppelin), and Smoke On the Water (Deep Purple). Stu also shouted out Australian band Cold Chisel. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg contained a Hypertension tease. Am I In Heaven? contained Evil Death Roll, and Converge teases and Hot Water teases and quotes. Sad Pilot was on the printed setlist but was skipped.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition of 1200
Holographic Edition of 300

The intro to O.N.E. contained a Straws in The Wind tease. The Book was played for the first time since 2023-03-07	(82 show gap). Gaia contained a You Can Be Your Sillhouette tease and featured a drum solo. Plastic Boogie was played for the first time since 2023-06-13 (55 show gap). This Thing contained The Dripping Tap teases and a Hell's Itch tease. Slow Jam 1 and Sense featured Ambrose on sax. Before Field of Vision, the band pretended like they were going to play Hog Calling Contest but they did a jam loosely based on it with lyrics based on the movie The Mask. Big Fig Wasp contained the ending of Robot Stop as the intro. The intro to People-Vultures and the song itself contained Iron Lung jams with lyrics. Iron Lung contained a People-Vultures jam with lyrics.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 600
Foil Edition - 150

Evil Death Roll contained You Can Be Your Silhouette and Field of Vision teases. Field of Vision was dedicated to the city of Nashville. Raw Feel contained a Witchcraft tease. Black Tooth was played for the first time since 2022-10-02. (118 show gap) Le Risque was dedicated to Johnny Cash. I'm Not In Your Mind featured Ambrose on sax. Hot Wax contained a Am I In Heaven? tease. After I'm In Your Mind Fuzz, Stu thanked Trey [Anastasio] because a fan threw a shirt on stage of the Phish logo with the letters altered to say Gizz. Slow Jam 1 featured Ambrose on sax and Hypertension, You Can Be Your Sillouhette, and Witchcraft teases. Perihelion featured Jay Weinberg (formerly of Slipknot) on drums. Chang'e contained an intro jam with Extinction quotes and the song itself contained Witchcraft quotes. Extinction contained an Intergalactic (Beastie Boys) quote.

Poster by Jason Galea
Standard Edition - 650
Foil Edition - 200

data.jamchart_notes: Opened with a Sense-like intro and settled into a blissed-out, psychedelic jam with an Am I In Heaven? tease. Crumbling Castle teases and the surrounding jamming adds a hint of unease; -> This Thing.
data.shownotes: Slow Jam 1 contained Crumbling Castle and Am I In Heaven? teases. This Thing contained Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes. Am I In Heaven? contained The Land Before Timeland, Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) and Witchcraft teases and a Slow Jam 1 jam with lyrics, and featured improvised alternate lyrics. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs. Nuclear Fusion featured community taper Mystery Jack for the vocal intro. Hog Calling Contest was teased prior to Antarctica, which contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Boogieman Sam contained La Grange (ZZ Top) teases and a Riff Raff (AC/DC) jam. Following Boogieman Sam, Joey mentioned that the band would be performing at the Hollywood Bowl with the L.A. Philharmonic on their upcoming tour in 2025, which was previously unannounced at the time. Texas Flood and Pride and Joy (Stevie Ray Vaughan) were teased prior to Daily Blues, which contained Hot Water teases. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases, This Thing quotes, Forty Six and 2 (Tool) teases and Master of the Universe (Hawkwind) teases and quotes. Gamma Knife was unfinished. Ice V contained The Lord of Lightning teases. The Lord of Lightning contained Cellophane teases. Le Risque featured Jay Weinberg on drums. Additionally, Cavs got an audience member to perform a laugh for the song and brought Jay's wife Chloe on stage to perform the 'Let's Ride' vocal part. Following Le Risque, Amby quoted I Love L.A. (Randy Newman).

Joey introduced Cavs as "Michael Caviar" before Hell and after Self-Immolate.  This Thing contained quotes of She's So Fine (The Jimi Hendrix Experience) and Incredible (M Beat). The Grim Reaper contained Get Low (Lil John), Torture Chamber, and Extinction quotes. Extinction contained the Flamethrower quotes from the extended mix. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases. Gamma Knife contained a People-Vultures outro.

Antarctica was dedicated to "all the polar bears in denial" and contained Daily Blues quotes and Ice V and Block of Ice (Osees) teases. Ice V contained Head On/Pill and Blindness (The Fall) teases. Gamma Knife contained Converge teases.  People-Vultures contained Iron Lung teases & quotes and Phantom Island quotes. Stu said "Free Palestine" before Boogieman Sam, which contained an Eternal Return vocal jam, Am I In Heaven? teases and a Riff Raff (AC/DC) tease. Slow Jam 1 contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Am I In Heaven? was unfinished and contained a Sad Pilot jam and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. The intro to Self-Immolate contained Am I In Heaven? teases and a drum solo where Stu, Joey, and an audience member shaved most of Stu's head.

data.jamchart_notes: This was the debut of the synth table version of Slow Jam 1. It also featured Ambrose on saxophone.
data.shownotes: Lucas' kid Monty was brought on stage before the show. Gaia featured a short drum solo by Cavs. Following the conclusion of Gaia Cookie quoted In the Jailhouse Now (Jimmie Rodgers) with lyrics changed to "in the big house now."  1 Thing (Amerie) was quoted before This Thing. Ambrose was given a police cap during Field of Vision which he wore for the rest of the song and engaged in police related antics with band photographer Maclay Heriot. Sad Pilot contained an Antarctica tease, teases of Head On/Pill and Hot Water, and a tease of The River. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases.  Before Work This Time Ambrose quoted Work It (Missy Elliott).  Shanghai contained Grow Wings and Fly teases and Slow Jam 1 quotes. Slow Jam 1 was performed in an alternate synth version for the first time and featured Ambrose on saxophone.  Swan Song was unfinished, contained Slow Jam 1 quotes and Shanghai teases and was followed by a My Generation (Limp Bizkit) tease by Cavs.  Head On/Pill featured Ambrose playing "slide harmonica" on Stu's guitar and Lewis Stiles of King Stingray drumming with Cavs, and contained Sea of Trees quotes.
data.soundcheck: Gamma Knife, Iron Lung (partial), Slow Jam 1 (synth version), Shanghai, Work This Time (no jam), Sleepwalker (partial), Magenta Mountain (partial)

data.shownotes: Slow Jam 1 featured Ambrose on saxophone and contained an Am I In Heaven? tease. Empty was performed for the first time since 2014-12-19 (644 show gap), and was performed with flute for the first time. Hot Wax was played by request of Wayne Gordon (who recorded I'm In Your Mind Fuzz and Quarters! at Daptone Studios and made a brief appearance on stage) and contained an Am I In Heaven? tease. A fan named Callum was brought onto stage to play Superbug on Stu's guitar instead of Stu. Magenta Mountain contained Forty Six & 2 (Tool) and Magma teases. The Grim Reaper contained Forty Six & 2 (Tool) teases and Intergalactic, Sabotage (both Beastie Boys), and Torture Chamber quotes. Following The Grim Reaper, Joey said he was ripping off Wes Borland (of Limp Bizkit), and Ambrose said he needed a red hat (Fred Durst's signature hat). Swan Song contained Magenta Mountain teases and quotes. Le Risque featured Jay Weinberg on drums instead of Cavs. Ice V featured Joey on flute during the intro and contained a quote of Aqualung (Jethro Tull) and teases of Ants & Bats and Blindness (The Fall). Raw Feel contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Hot Water contained I'm In Your Mind and Robot Stop teases.  Following Hot Water, Joey shouted out festival act The Mystery Lights, saying they were the first band they co-headlined with in America. Boogieman Sam contained The Bitter Boogie, Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. During Straws In The Wind, Ambrose walked through the crowd to Jason at the soundboard and when he returned to stage, he did an impression of Fred Durst. After Straws In The Wind, the band pretended it was Jason's birthday and sang Happy Birthday to him. During Pleura, Joey said "Fuck Donald Trump", with Ambrose responding "Juicy [Jason] for President!" Dimathaya Burarrwanga and Yimila Gurruwiwi from King Stingray joined the band for Rattlesnake on yiḏaki (didgeridoo), and Dimathaya quoted Treaty (Yothu Yindi). At the end of the show, Joey said Free Palestine and Ambrose led the crowd in a chant of "Free Free Palestine".

This show featured the debut of Hell's Itch, which was also the synth version and contained Joey's and Stu's final verses only, and "LUSEQ". Theia contained a Hot Water tease from Stu on electric flute. Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap teases. Slow Jam 1 contained a Hell's Itch jam. Hell's Itch contained a substantial lyrical portion of Pure Shores (All Saints) before reprising the "finally red" chorus. Murder of the Universe was performed in an electronic version for the first time.

Hell's Itch was missing Stu's final verse. Slow Jam 1 had a Hot Water tease. Kepler-22b had it's lyrics changed to "dancin' is good for ya" and featured Blindness (The Fall) teases. Gilgamesh was labeled "Frankenstein" on the printed setlist and contained Kepler-22b quotes. Joey said "Free Palestine" at the end of the show.

data.jamchart_notes: Electronic arrangement with some meandering and ambient sections as well as some heavier sections with lots of bass. Longest rendition to date.
data.shownotes:
During Swan Song, the band's electronics cut out repeatedly leading Joey to call for a drum solo, which Cavs duly provided while the band troubleshooted. Extinction contained Blue Morpho quotes toward the end. During Blue Morpho, the band's electronics crashed again and the song was abandoned. During the pause the crowd called for a drum solo, which Cavs returned to the stage to provide once more and which contained Dragon teases. The subsequent "...Maddy Jam..." included opener Maddie Ashman on cello; early within the jam, Stu said, "if you like this, it means you're avant-garde". Set contained Gila Monster and Extinction quotes. Ambrose performed the verses of Smoke & Mirrors out of order, included all the lyrics from The Grim Reaper as well as Torture Chamber quotes, and changed the lyrics to "another little man trying to live the dream" as well as "Grim Reaper shits on your chest".

Due to the technical issues plaguing the first half of the show, the setlist was changed considerably from what was on the printed setlists, which read: Swan Song, Candles, Extinction, Blue Morpho, Maddy Jam, No Body, Slow Jam I, Magma, Smoke and Mirrors, Set.
